comments:
This course covers advanced topics in physical chemistry including solution and
colloid chemistry, electrochemistry, surface phenomena, and macromolecules applied to
biological systems.
Students unanimously agreed that the class was difficult but “enjoyable” and
“interesting.” Many students reflected that the lecture material did not match the
textbook, making it difficult to study for quizzes and exams. They also felt that there
should have been more practice problems assigned to prepare them for the tests.
Students praised Professor Radharkrishnan’s ability to link theoretical chemistry
concepts to applications in bioengineering. However, a few commented that his section of
this course was more difficult than the other section.
Overall, the course was described as “highly theoretical” and “very challenging.”
This class is recommended for Bioengineering majors only.
